skillTree.localised_description: The world of man will fall at the Beastlord's hand, with every glittering city reduced to rubble and despair.
"The blood is the prize. The blood is the prize! THE BLOOD IS THE PRIZE!"
He knows. Nobody knows how, but he does. He has always just known.
Chaos smiles upon them, granting unnatural and heretical defence against mortal machinations.
Resplendent with his new sets of headgear, Ungrol capered in the moonlight, gazing with manic glee at his shadow and singing 'Four-horn, four-horn!' over and over again.

enabled_if: A Lord has been routed or killed

skillTree.localised_description: Over the years Ungrol's legend has spread, and through channelling his vast reservoir of hatred he has come to be a warrior of some repute.
The bizarre warping of his form caused by the mutations of Chaos have given Ungrol some protections against the dangers of the world.

Many Ungors have joined Ungrol's cause and he now commands a force of mutants, outcasts and monsters that raid the lands of men, taking out their hatred upon any they can catch and keeping their human captives like cattle in the dank depths of the Labyrinth of the Spurned.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +15% for Ungors
	(all units in army)

Enables poison attacks for all Ungor units
	(all units in army)

Missile strength: +15% for Ungor Raiders units
	(all units in army)

skillTree.localised_description: Ungrol was born with two heads, each of which was possessed of a singular ugliness. The mewling beast was greeted with utter revulsion by his human parents, and so Ungrol was cast out into the woods to die.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +20% when fighting against Empire and Bretonnia
Weapon strength: +20% when fighting against Beastmen

skillTree.localised_description: There is no more hateful a creature in the Old World, for he has been cast out of the ranks of both man and beast. Such was the scale of his transgressions that he has become something of a legend, and to this day he leads as a self-styled beggar king, marching at the head of a ragtag army of outcasts, mutants, and heretics who have nowhere else to run.
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Creatures with tough hides or some kind of natural armour are tough nuts to crack - even a powerful attack may fall foul of their thick-skin.
The desire to wreak havoc is innate, brought about not by choice but by sheer force of being.
A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
It is never enough. The food, the drink, the slaughter. It is never, ever enough.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
The weird, evil moon hangs low in the sky, drawing reverence from its abominable worshippers.
Spellcasters can oft-sense when magic is close or being drawn from the Winds.

effects.description: Scouting action: Magic item drop chance is increased by an additional 5%
Scouting action: Magic item drop chance is increased by an additional 10%
Scouting action: Magic item drop chance is increased by an additional 15%

skillTree.localised_description: The locals take notice and will be inspired or frightened into action.

effects.description: Spread Corruption action: Chaos Undivided corruption is increased by an additional 1
Spread Corruption action: Chaos Undivided corruption is increased by an additional 2
Spread Corruption action: Chaos Undivided corruption is increased by an additional 3

skillTree.localised_description: They cannot stop what they cannot see.

effects.description: Damage Walls action: 1 additional wall breaches
Damage Walls action: 2 additional wall breaches
Damage Walls action: 3 additional wall breaches

skillTree.localised_description: Such a champion will not bend or break, but slay in their Lord's name.

effects.description: Wound action: Additional 5% chance of wounding target
Wound action: Additional 12% chance of wounding target
Wound action: Additional 21% chance of wounding target

skillTree.localised_description: The sight of a powerful figure extolling death and blasphemies can bring enemy ranks to their knees.

effects.description: Hinder Replenishment action: Replenishment is modified by an additional -10%
Hinder Replenishment action: Replenishment is modified by an additional -20%
Hinder Replenishment action: Replenishment is modified by an additional -40%

skillTree.localised_description: An expert in their craft, this Hero knows all the mistakes that can be made and how to best avoid making them.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.
This unit can pass through trees.
When this unit casts a spell, all of their spells will be randomly replaced by another spell.

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

items.colour_text: Ungrol's 'horns' still contain a residue of their former owners' power, meaning that he can often be found bickering with himself or speaking the dark tongues of magic, including rudimentary casting of Wild Magic.

effects.description: All spells from the Lore of the Wild are added to the Scrolls of Sorcery

target_if: Not on or below a platform
Not on or below a platform

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Ungrol stole his "four-horns" by killing the Beastlord and the Bray Shaman of his tribe. For his crimes, he was cast out, and now leads as a self-styled beggar king, marching at the head of a ragtag army of outcasts, mutants, and heretics who have nowhere else to run.

effects.description: Dread cost: -50% for increasing capacity of Ungor Herd and Ungor Spearmen Herd (Shields) units
